intro: Chomelia sylvicola, commonly known as the swamp chomelia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands and lowland forests of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Its flowers are small and clustered in terminal inflorescences, usually white or pale yellow, and are pollinated by insects. The plant thrives in humid environments and is often found in swampy or seasonally flooded areas.
